p: The Apiaceae plants celery ( Apium graveolens), coriander ( Coriandrum sativum), and parsley ( Petroselinum crispum) were collected during the flowering period from the Tinghir region located in the southeast of Morocco (Latitude: 31° 30′ 53″ N, Longitude: −5° 31′ 58″ W, Altitude: 1300 m). Voucher specimens were used to identify plants and were deposited in the herb facility of the Faculty of Sciences and Techniques at Errachidia, Morocco. Plant samples were first dried and, then, stored away from light at room temperature (25°C) prior extraction.
